snippet: When voters go to the polls next week, one issue underlies all others: whether this vibrantly democratic island should speed, slow or halt its wary embrace of China.
abstract: Issue confronting Taiwanese voters when they head to the polls is whether the vibrantly democratic island of 23 million should speed, slow or halt its embrace of China; Taiwan's Pres Ma Ying-jeou, who has overseen warmed relations with China, faces off against main opponent Tsai Ing-wen, who advocates formal independence.
lead_paragraph: When voters go to the polls next week, one issue underlies all others: whether this vibrantly democratic island should speed, slow or halt its wary embrace of China.

headline.seo: In Taiwan Elections, Question of China Looms
headline.main: Ties to China Linger as Issue as Taiwanese Prepare to Vote
headline.print_headline: Ties to China Linger as Issue As Taiwanese Prepare to Vote
